title: Digital Gambling Boom Results In 80 Million Facing Disorders Worldwide
content: A recent study by The Lancet Public Health Commission reveals that approximately 80 million people worldwide suffer from gambling disorders, with adolescents being the most affected.
summary: A recent study by The Lancet Public Health Commission reveals that approximately 80 million people worldwide suffer from gambling disorders, with adolescents being the most affected.

title: Iran Says It Has "Right" To Defend Itself After Today's Strikes
content: Iran warned on Saturday it would defend itself after Israeli air strikes killed at least two soldiers and further stoked fears of a full-scale regional war in the Middle East.
summary: Iran warned on Saturday it would defend itself after Israeli air strikes killed at least two soldiers and further stoked fears of a full-scale regional war in the Middle East.

title: "Military Worked In Unimaginable Conditions": S Jaishankar On China Pact
content: Despite the patrolling agreement with China, which was announced earlier this week, it will take time to rebuild trust and for the two countries to be willing to work with each other, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said.
summary: Despite the patrolling agreement with China, which was announced earlier this week, it will take time to rebuild trust and for the two countries to be willing to work with each other, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said.

title: 16 Vloggers, TikTokers Arrested In Pakistan For Spreading Fake News Of Rape
content: Law enforcement agencies have arrested more than a dozen vloggers and TikTokers accusing them of spreading fake stories about an alleged rape of a girl student that led to violent protests across Punjab province over a week ago.
summary: Law enforcement agencies have arrested more than a dozen vloggers and TikTokers accusing them of spreading fake stories about an alleged rape of a girl student that led to violent protests across Punjab province over a week ago.

title: 3 Health Workers Injured, 44 Detained At Gaza Hospital: WHO
content: The World Health Organization said it has regained contact with staff at a besieged northern Gaza hospital, finding that three health workers had been injured and 44 detained.
summary: The World Health Organization said it has regained contact with staff at a besieged northern Gaza hospital, finding that three health workers had been injured and 44 detained.

title: 8 Killed In Suicide Bombing In Pakistan: Cops
content: A suicide bomber detonated at a checkpoint in western Pakistan on Saturday, killing eight people and wounding five more, officials said.
summary: A suicide bomber detonated at a checkpoint in western Pakistan on Saturday, killing eight people and wounding five more, officials said.

title: 10 Cops Killed In "Terrorist Attack" In Iran: Report
content: At least 10 police officers were killed in a "terrorist attack" in an area of southeastern Iran long plagued by unrest, local media reported on Saturday.
summary: At least 10 police officers were killed in a "terrorist attack" in an area of southeastern Iran long plagued by unrest, local media reported on Saturday.

title: Chronic Kidney Disease Cases In Women Tripled In Last 3 Decades: Study
content: The number of chronic kidney disease (CKD) cases in women has nearly tripled in the past three decades globally, according to a new study led by researchers from the Gujarat Adani Institute of Medical Sciences (GAIMS).
summary: The number of chronic kidney disease (CKD) cases in women has nearly tripled in the past three decades globally, according to a new study led by researchers from the Gujarat Adani Institute of Medical Sciences (GAIMS).

title: Syria Backs Iran's "Right To Self-Defense" After Israeli Strikes
content: Syria condemned Israeli air strikes against Iran on Saturday, saying it affirmed its ally's right to self-defence.
summary: Syria condemned Israeli air strikes against Iran on Saturday, saying it affirmed its ally's right to self-defence.

title: 6 Russian Convicts Escape Prison Through Secret Tunnel, Manhunt Launched
content: Russian authorities announced a manhunt on Saturday after six convicts tunnelled their way out a correctional facility.
summary: Russian authorities announced a manhunt on Saturday after six convicts tunnelled their way out a correctional facility.

title: Israel's Long-Distance Strike On Iran Has Parallels To 1981 Attack On Iraq
content: An Israeli attack on Iran targeted military sites today, killing two soldiers, almost a month after Israel vowed to avenge a missile barrage that raised fears of a full-scale Middle East war. The airstrikes hit Iran's missile manufacturing units.
summary: An Israeli attack on Iran targeted military sites today, killing two soldiers, almost a month after Israel vowed to avenge a missile barrage that raised fears of a full-scale Middle East war. The airstrikes hit Iran's missile manufacturing units.

title: Seoul Spending $327 Million To Stop "Lonely Deaths" Epidemic. What It Is
content: Seoul authorities, while announcing the $327 million initiative this week, stated that they want to "create a city where no one is lonely."
summary: Seoul authorities, while announcing the $327 million initiative this week, stated that they want to "create a city where no one is lonely."

title: "Blatant Violation Of Sovereignty": Hamas After Israel Strikes Iran
content: Hamas, at war with Israel in Gaza, on Saturday said it strongly condemned Israeli strikes on military targets in Iran.
summary: Hamas, at war with Israel in Gaza, on Saturday said it strongly condemned Israeli strikes on military targets in Iran.

title: US Sends Back Illegal Indian Immigrants On Chartered Flight Ahead Of Polls
content: The US hired a chartered flight to deport Indian nationals who were staying in the country illegally, the Department of Homeland Security has said, noting that this has been done in cooperation with the Indian government.
summary: The US hired a chartered flight to deport Indian nationals who were staying in the country illegally, the Department of Homeland Security has said, noting that this has been done in cooperation with the Indian government.

title: "Rejecting Escalation": Saudi Arabia Condemns Israel's Strikes On Iran
content: Saudi Arabia condemned Israeli strikes on military targets in Iran on Saturday, warning against any further expansion of the conflict in the Middle East.
summary: Saudi Arabia condemned Israeli strikes on military targets in Iran on Saturday, warning against any further expansion of the conflict in the Middle East.

title: Video Of Ballots Of Trump Being Destroyed 'Fake', Russia Responsible: US
content: Russian actors were behind a viral video falsely showing mail-in ballots for Donald Trump being destroyed in the swing state of Pennsylvania, US officials said.
summary: Russian actors were behind a viral video falsely showing mail-in ballots for Donald Trump being destroyed in the swing state of Pennsylvania, US officials said.

title: Assassinations, Cyberattacks: How Israel Attacked Iran Over The Years
content: From hitjobs to sabotages and cyberattacks, Israel has either been blamed for or has itself claimed a variety of attacks against Iran.
summary: From hitjobs to sabotages and cyberattacks, Israel has either been blamed for or has itself claimed a variety of attacks against Iran.

title: All You Need To Know About NASA-ISRO Mission's Radar Antenna Reflector
content: The radar antenna reflector for the NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar (NISAR) mission arrived at the spacecraft integration and test facility of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) in Bengaluru this week.
summary: The radar antenna reflector for the NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar (NISAR) mission arrived at the spacecraft integration and test facility of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) in Bengaluru this week.

title: What Scientists Say About Holy Grail Cup Found Where Indiana Jones Was Filmed
content: Archaeologists have disclosed the origin of the famous "holy grail" cup, which was found with 12 human skeletons at the spot in Jordan where the 1989 film Indiana Jones and The Last Crusade was filmed.
summary: Archaeologists have disclosed the origin of the famous "holy grail" cup, which was found with 12 human skeletons at the spot in Jordan where the 1989 film Indiana Jones and The Last Crusade was filmed.

title: "Stop Donating To Wikipedia, Controlled By Far-Left Activists": Elon Musk
content: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk has appealed to the public to stop donating to the internet 'encyclopaedia' Wikipedia for allegedly letting itself be misused as a platform "controlled by far-Left activists."
summary: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk has appealed to the public to stop donating to the internet 'encyclopaedia' Wikipedia for allegedly letting itself be misused as a platform "controlled by far-Left activists."
